title: Instruments with smartphone
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to play instrument sounds with your smartphone.

Select **SmartphoneOrientation** to access the orientation data from your smartphone's accelerometer.

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/SmartphoneOrientation-Item.png)

This will be used to choose the sound to be played depending on the orientation of the smartphone.

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press devices again, select **DrumKeyboard**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/SmartphoneOrientation-Item.png)

to use your smartphone as an instrument sounds player.
Press on your smartphone **Add another input/output via QR code**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Add-another-input-output-via-qr.jpeg)
and scan the QR code. Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar,

move the **if** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png)
and the **comparison** ![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png)

components to the workspace

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/Math.png) on the sidebar,
move the **number** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png) component to the workspace, four times.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/Timing.png) on the sidebar,

move the **delay**
![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/delay-component.png)

component to the workspace

Move the **Orientation**
![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/instruments-with-smartphone/orientation.png)
four times to the workspace, and the

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/instruments-with-smartphone/play.png)
components to the workspace.

Put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/instruments-with-smartphone/blocks.png)

The idea is that depending on the orientation of the smartphone a particular sound will be played.

To constantly check the orientation of the smartphone we will use the main loop component, which allows us to rerun the code after it has finished executing.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/Loops.png) on the sidebar.

Then, move to the workspace the
![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/main-loop-component.png)
component and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/instruments-with-smartphone/main-loop.png)
